title: San Juan National Historic Site: Archive
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park     News     News Releases     Archive                Archive           Subscribe  | What is RSS     September 22, 2015  San Juan National Historic Site launches “Every Kid in a Park Initiative”  San Juan, Puerto Rico- Superintendent Walter J. Chavez announced today that San Juan National Historic Site will launch the “Every Kid in a Park Initiative” Thursday, September 24, 2015, with the visit of 3 of its neighboring schools, Abraham Lincoln, Martin Brumbaugh, and Colegio San Agustin.  Approximately 40, 4th graders will be transported to Castillo San Felipe del Morro and learn about the history of the fortifications. As previously announced, San Juan NHS has embarked on an ambitious goal of bringing every 4th grader on the island to this National Park to support the initiative announced by President Obama, which was created to invite every 4th grader in the nation to experience and connect with the great outdoors and be inspired to become future stewards.   April 27, 2015  Tourism to San Juan National Historic Site Creates 77 6 milllion In Economic Benefits Report Shows Visitor Spending Supports 985 Jobs In Local Economy  San Juan, Puerto Rico- A new National Park Service (NPS) report shows that 1,382,906 visitors for San Juan National Historic Site in 2014 spent 77.6 million in communities near the park.  That spending supported 985 jobs in the local area and had a cumulative benefit to the local economy of 94.4 million.   April 06, 2015  San Juan National Historic Site Hosting National Park Week APRIL 18-26  2015  Superintendent Walter J. Chavez announced today that San Juan National Historic Site will host a week of activities for visitors during the annual National Park Week celebration. “The staff of San Juan National Historic Site have put together an ambitious week of diverse activities for our visitors this year to celebrate National Park Week” said Superintendent Chavez. “We plan on having something for everyone to enjoy, from Living History (firing demonstrations) and Ranger led programs, such as Tunnel Tours, Lantern Light Tours, Dungeon Talks to our very special Little Masons program”   March 03, 2015  San Juan NHS hosting El Morro Pet Fest  San Juan National Historic Site will host the 4th Annual Pet Festival at Castillo San Felipe del Morro on Sunday, March 8, 2015 from 10:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m.   February 12, 2015  San Juan National Historic Site Celebrates 66th Anniversary  Superintendent Walter J. Chavez invites you to join us this Saturday, February 14, 2015 as the park celebrates the 66th Anniversary of becoming San Juan National Historic Site. “Come and celebrate our 66th birthday as a National Historic Site” said Superintendent Walter J. Chavez. San Juan National Historic Site was officially designated in 1949.   January 15, 2015  CELEBRATE MARTIN LUTHER KING JR. DAY AT  SAN JUAN NATIONAL HISTORIC SITE  WITH FREE ENTRANCE TO THE FORTIFICATIONS OF OLD SAN JUAN  Superintendent Walter J. Chavez announces nine more reasons to enjoy San Juan National Historic Site.   January 15, 2015  CLOSURE AT SAN JUAN NATIONAL HISTORIC SITE’S, CASTILLO SAN FELIPE DE EL MORRO  Superintendent Walter J. Chavez announces that during the Fiestas de la Calle San Sebastian celebration, areas of the grounds of Castillo San Felipe del Morro will be closed to the public. This closure will remain in effect each day January 15-19th from 7:00 pm to 5:00 am and federal law (36 CFR 1.5) will be strictly enforced.   December 11, 2014  2014 Artisans in December at Castillo San Cristobal  San Juan National Historic Site announces “Artisans in December” to be held December 13-14, 2014 at Castillo San Cristobal.  This is the third consecutive year the park has hosted artisans in December.  The park will welcome a select group of local artisans to showcase and sell their art work. The “Artisans in December” program will be available from 9 am to 6 pm on Saturday and Sunday on Placita Norzagaray (next to the historical entrance).   November 25, 2014  THANKSGIVING DAY CLOSURE  San Juan, PR. –San Juan National Historic will be closed Thanksgiving Day, Thursday, November 27.   October 02, 2014  PASEO DEL MORRO  INAUGURATION AND FREE FEE DAY  San Juan, PR. –San Juan National Historic Site will inaugurate the latest phase of the Paseo del Morro. The Paseo del Morro is a Nationally Designated Trail, designated in 2001, internationally recognized  which aims to connect, natural, cultural and historic areas of the communities of Old San Juan, La Perla and Puerta de Tierra. The inauguration Ceremony will be held on Saturday, October 4th, 2014 at 10:00 a.m. This latest completion of the trail will allow visitors to experience the spectacular walls of Castillo San Felipe del Morro in a way that was not possible before.  “On Saturday visitors can enter the fortification of El Morro from the Paseo del Morro”, announced Superintendent Walter J. Chavez.  Entrance fees on this day will be waived in conjunction with the Inauguration’ added Chavez.   September 15, 2014  SAN JUAN NATIONAL HISTORIC SITE CELEBRATES NATIONAL PUBLIC LANDS DAY  San Juan, PR. – On Saturday, September 27, 2014, San Juan National Historic Site will be celebrating National Public Lands Day (NPLD) with free admission. “During previous National Public Lands Day volunteers throughout the United States have built trails, planted trees and plants, removed trash and invasive plants, as well as contribute to many other projects” commented Superintendent Walter J. Chavez.   July 18, 2014  San Juan National Historic Site Celebrates 10th Annual Artisan Fair  Superintendent Walter J. Chavez announces the 10th  Annual Artisan Fair en El Morro will be held this weekend July 19-20.  The annual Artisan Fair is held at Castillo San Felipe del Morro from 9:00-6:00 each day.   May 30, 2014  Improvement To Visitor Center Parking Facilities At Castillo San Cristobal  San Juan, PR – Construction and improvements to the Visitor Center parking lot will begin on June 2, 2014.   For the next 3 weeks the Visitor parking lot at Castillo San Cristobal located on Avenida Muñoz Rivera will be closed.  Access will be limited to pedestrians and official vehicles only. Tour busses will drop off their clients at the entrance to the parking lot and will need to relocate until it is time to pick up their guests.   April 24, 2014  San Juan National Historic Site Fee Change  San Juan, PR – Superintendent Walter J. Chavez announces a fee change for San Juan National Historic Site. The fee change will go into effect on May 1, 2014.   April 16, 2014  Celebrate National Park Week with Free Admission and Special Events  Go Wild for San Juan National Historic Site! San Juan, PR – Go wild for history at San Juan National Historic Site during National Park Week, April 19 through 27, 2014. To get the celebration going, entrance to Castillos San Felipe del Morro and San Cristobal will be free on April 19 and 20.   February 07, 2014  10th Annual Kite Festival at Castillo San Felipe del Morro  San Juan NHS will hold it's 10th Annual Kite Festival on the historic grounds of Castillo San Felipe del Morro on Sunday February 16, 2014 from 11:00AM to 3:00PM.   December 13, 2013  Artisans in December at Castillo San Cristobal  San Juan National Historic Site Superintendent Walter J. Chavez announces the “Artisans in December” activity to be held in the park. For the second consecutive year Castillo San Cristobal will welcome a select group of local artisans to showcase and sell their art work. The Artisans in December program will be offered during the weekend of December 14-15, and will be available from 9 am to 6 pm on Saturday and Sunday. Artisans will be displaying and selling crafts such as; wood carvings, musical instruments, glass, jewelry and will be providing demonstrations of their craft making. In addition, we will present the Lelolai show at Placita Norzagaray with the Areyto dancers and musical group on Saturday, December 14 at 4:30 pm. Lelolai performances will also be offered on January 6 and January 12, at Castillo San Cristobal. Please come and join us, “I encourage everyone to come and visit as well as enjoy the performance of Areyto at Castillo San Cristobal during this activity and enjoy what our local artisans have to offer” said Superintendent Walter J. Chavez. “It will also give our visitors a glimpse of the beautiful local crafts that Puerto Rico has to offer, and possibly consider purchasing an original Puerto Rican craft for a Christmas gift.” added Superintendent Chavez.   November 06, 2013  INVITATION & NOTIFICATION TO THE PUBLIC  Superintendent Walter J. Chavez invites you to an “Open House” where we will introduce San Juan National Historic Site’s new Fee change proposal. We are encouraging you to participate and provide us with your comments regarding this proposal. Event will take place at Castillo San Cristóbal A/V Room the evenings of November 13th and November 14th   from 6:00 pm to 8:00 pm. We would appreciate if you can confirm your participation to Jessica_Oppenheimer@nps.gov.   July 12, 2013  9th Annual Artisan’s Fair 2013  Superintendent Walter J. Chavez invites you to participate in our “9th Annual Artisan Fair at El Morro”.  Come and enjoy a weekend with local artisans and celebrate our rich heritage in the arts on July 19 -21, 2013.  Over 200 artisans have been invited to this wonderful activity, which promises to be the largest yet from 9 a.m. to 7 p.m. each day. We will have educational ranger talks, artisan’s demonstrations, typical food and music for your enjoyment.   September 25, 2012  SAN JUAN NHS 2012 PUBLIC LANDS DAY CELEBRATION  On Saturday, September 29, San Juan National Historic Site will celebrate National Public Lands Day (NPLD), a national volunteer event.   Volunteers will work around the shoreline of Fort San Juan de la Cruz, also known as El Cañuelo in Isla de Cabras, Toa Baja,  and help remove the litter that clutters the beauty of the historical fort and its surrounding waterfront.   September 24, 2012  Launched by the National Park Service  The important role Latino peoples have played in the history and development of the United States is highlighted in the National Park Service’s newest online travel itinerary, American Latino Heritage.   August 23, 2012  RE-OPENING  NOTIFICATION  RE-OPENING  NOTIFICATION   August 22, 2012  Temporary Closure Notification  Superintendent Walter J. Chavez announces that Castillo San Cristóbal and Castillo San Felipe del Morro will be closed to the public effective at noon time, Wednesday, August 22, 2012. San Juan National Historic Site is taking precautionary visitor and personnel safety measures due to the forecasted hazardous rainy and windy conditions expected over the island. The fortifications will remain closed to the public until further notice.   June 12, 2012  8th ANNUAL ARTISAN FAIR AT CASTILLO SAN FELIPE DEL MORRO  San Juan National Historic Site will once again host an Artisan Fair on the grounds of El Morro. This year’s Artisan Fair de El Morro will be expanded to three days and will be held from Friday, July 20 through Sunday, July 22, from 9:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m.  Over 150 artisans from the island are expected to participate in this year’s fair.   June 06, 2012  FREE ENTRANCE ON JUNE 9TH TO THE SAN JUAN NATIONAL HISTORIC SITE  San Juan National Historic Site will be offering free entrance to the fortifications of Castillo San Cristobal and Castillo San Felipe del Morro during National Get Outdoors Day, Saturday, June 9, 2012.  National Get Outdoors Day, now in its fifth year, encourages Americans, especially youth, to participate in outdoor activities while enjoying the beauty of public lands such as national parks, forests, and wildlife refuges. The free entrance day creates an opportunity for families and communities to get outside, be active and have fun.   June 04, 2012  MILITARY PASS FOR FREE ADMISSION  Starting on Armed Forces Day, Saturday, May 19, 2012, active duty service members of the U.S. military and their dependents will be offered a free annual pass allowing free access to national parks, wildlife refuges, national forests and other Federal public lands, as a way to thanking America’s Armed Forces.   June 04, 2012  PRELUDE TO THE CASTILLO SAN FELIPE DEL MORRO ARTISAN FAIR  San Juan National Historic Site will again host an Artisan Fair on the grounds of El Morro from Friday, July 20 through Sunday, July 22, from 10:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m.  Over 150 artisans from the island are expected to participate in this year’s fair.   As a prelude to the Fair and to help promote the event, local artisans will provide demonstrations and sell their crafts in Castillo San Felipe del Morro every weekend beginning June 9th through July 15 th. These artisans will be featured from  9 am to 6 pm each Saturday and Sunday leading up to the fair.   April 25, 2012  1797 SAN JUAN ATTACK COMMEMORATION  Superintendent Walter J. Chavez invites the public to the San Juan National Historic Site third annual commemoration of the 1797 British Attack on San Juan which took place from 17 April - 2 May 1797.   April 19, 2012  PARTIAL CLOSURE OF THE PASEO DEL MORRO  Park Superintendent Walter J. Chavez announced a portion of the Paseo del Morro will be closed indefinitely to the public effective Tuesday, April 17, 2012.   April 02, 2012  FREE ENTRANCE TO CASTILLO SAN FELIPE DEL MORRO AND CASTILLO SAN CRISTOBAL DURING NATIONAL PARK WEEK, APRIL 21-29  Superintendent Walter J. Chavez announces free entrance to Castillo San Cristóbal and Castillo San Felipe del Morro during National Park Week, April 21 to 29.  The National Park Service invites the public to visit their national parks free of charge, to have fun and to reconnect with history and nature during this year’s celebration of National Park Week.   February 27, 2012  San Juan National Historic Site Hosting El Morro Pet Fest  On Sunday, March 4 the first ever  'El Morro Pet Fest' will be held on the grounds of Castillo San Felipe del Morro in old San Juan from 10 am to 5 pm. This event is sponsored by the San Juan National Historic Site, the Municipality of San Juan and Gravy Train.   February 13, 2012  FREE ADMISSION TO THE FORTIFICATIONS ON FEBRUARY 14TH  Castillo San Felipe del Morro and Castillo San Cristóbal will be open to the public free of charge on Tuesday, February 14th as part of the San Juan National Historic Site 63rd birthday   February 02, 2012  Eighth Annual Kite Festival at Castillo San Felipe del Morro  The public is invited to attend and participate in the 8th Annual San Juan National Historic Site Kite Festival on the beautiful historic grounds of Castillo San Felipe del Morro on Sunday, February 26 from 11:00am to 4:00pm.   January 24, 2012  Grand Opening of Discovery Center at San Juan National Historic Site  Superintendent Walter J. Chavez announces the grand opening of the Discovery Center at San Juan National Historic Site on Friday, January 27, 2012 at 9:30am.  The Discover Center, the heart of educational programming for children, is located just a few steps away from the historic entrance of Castillo San Cristobal on Calle Norzagaray, in what was originally a residence for US Army personnel in the 20th Century.   January 09, 2012  WEEKEND’S FREE ENTRANCE & GROUNDS CLOSURE  Superintendent Walter J. Chavez announces that entrance fee to Castillo San Felipe del Morro and Castillo San Cristóbal will be waived on January 14-16 for the Martin Luther King,Jr birthday observance.   December 12, 2011  NOTIFICATION TO THE PUBLIC  Superintendent Walter J. Chavez announces that access to the surrounding grounds of Castillo San Felipe del Morro will be LIMITED (36 CFR 1.5) to the public from 6:00 PM to 1:00 AM, during the days of Friday, December 16 and Saturday, December 17, 2011   December 12, 2011  TEMPORAY CLOSURE NOTIFICATION  Superintendent Walter J. Chavez announces that Castillo San Cristóbal and Castillo San Felipe del Morro will be closed to the public on Christmas Day, December 25, 2011 and on New Year’s Day, January 1, 2012.   December 01, 2011  FREE ENTRANCE TO THE FORTIFICATIONS OF THE SAN JUAN NATIONAL HISTORIC SITE  On Tuesday, December 6, San Juan National Historic Site will reach 27 years of being designated as a World Heritage Site by the Organization of the United Nations for the Education, Science and Culture (UNESCO).   November 29, 2011  INAUGURATION OF RESTORED RAIN HARVESTING SYSTEMS:SAN JUAN NATIONAL HISTORIC SITE  A brief inauguration ceremony to open the historical water cisterns beneath the plazas of Castillo San Felipe del Morro and Castillo San Cristóbal will take place in Castillo San Cristóbal on Friday, December 2 at 9:30am.   November 08, 2011  FREE ADMISSION IN COMMEMORATION OF VETERANS DAY  San Juan National Historic Site admission will be free from Friday, November 11 – Sunday, 13, 2011 to those visiting Castillo San Felipe del Morro and Castillo San Cristóbal in recognition of Veterans Day.   November 03, 2011  COMMEMORATION OF JOSE CAMPECHE: “CAMPECHADA”  San Juan National Historic Site, in collaboration with other government agencies, will host a series of activities to celebrate the life of 18th century Puerto Rican painter José Campeche. The commemoration, named Campechada, will take place from Friday, November 18 – Sunday, November 20, 2011.   September 22, 2011  Let's Celebrate National Public Lads Day  On Saturday, September 24, San Juan National Historic Site will celebrate National Public Lands Day, a free-fee day.For this celebration, the park is looking for volunteers to work from 9:00 am to 12:00 pm in assisting park staff and other volunteers in the removal of trash around Fort San Juan de la Cruz (known as El Cañuelo) and the beach around Isla de Cabras in Toa Baja.   August 16, 2011  Come for Story Telling in Castillo San Felipe del Morro  The National Park Service and the Sociedad de Amigos de la Historia invites families to their activity of historical readings, tales and legends to perform in Castillo San Felipe del Morro, Main Plaza, Sunday, August 21, 10:00am-3:00pm.   July 20, 2011  SAN JUAN NATIONAL HISTORIC SITE 7TH ANNUAL ARTISAN FAIR  You are invited to visit Castillo San Felipe del Morro to enjoy free of charge one of the premier artisan fairs on the island.   June 15, 2011  SAN JUAN NATIONAL HISTORIC SITE  OFFERS FREE ENTRANCE JUNE 21  Free admission to the park   April 26, 2011  COMMEMORATION OF THE 1797 BRITISH ATTACK  San Juan National Historic Site will conduct a series of activities as part of the commemoration of the third and final attempt by British forces to take control of the powerful military Spanish outpost of Puerto Rico.   April 14, 2011  GRAND PREMIERE OF VIDEO BOOKS  San Juan National Historic Site Superintendent Walter J. Chavez announces the grand premiere of "Misterio en El Morro" and "La Leyenda de la Garita del Diablo", two video books written and illustrated by a group of talented students from the Abraham Lincoln Elementary School in Old San Juan.  The free admission premiere will take place on Monday, April 18th, at 7:00 p.m. in the main plaza of Castillo San Cristóbal, with the students, their families and teachers, park staff and special invited guests present. The premiere will include a viewing of the two video books, along with recognizing the students for their outstanding work.   April 11, 2011  LEND A HELPING HAND IN KEEPING THE PASEO DEL MORRO BEAUTIFUL  No abstract supplied.   February 22, 2011  Seventh Annual Kite Festival at Castillo San Felipe del Morro  San Juan National Historic Site will hold its 7th Kite Festival on the beautiful historic grounds of El Morro on Sunday, February 27 from 11:00am to 4:00pm.   January 26, 2011  INVITATION TO PUBLIC MEEETINGS REGARDING FORT SAN GERÓNIMO  The National Park Service announces a series of public meetings to seek comments regarding Fort San Gerónimo.   January 13, 2011  ENTRANCE FEES WAIVED AND TEMPORARY CLOSING  Superintendent Walter J. Chavez announces that the entrance fee to the fortifications of San Juan National Historic Site will we waived for the Martin Luther King weekend January 15-17.   October 27, 2010  FEE FREE DAY IN COMMEMORATION OF 2010 VETERANS DAY  In recognition of the service of veterans and current members of the US Armed Forces, San Juan National Historic Site will offer free admission to visitors on Thursday, November 11, 2010.   October 27, 2010  CELEBRATE  INTERNATIONAL CHILDREN’S DAY  San Juan National Historic Site and Museo del Niño de Puerto Rico are joining efforts again this year to celebrate International Children’s Day on Sunday, November 14 on the grounds of Castillo San Felipe del Morro from 10:30 a.m. to 2:30 pm.   September 22, 2010  DEVELOPING EL PASEO DEL MORRO EXTENSION FROM THE BOTTOM UP  No abstract supplied.   September 21, 2010  NATIONAL SAN JUAN NATIONAL HISTORIC SITE TO WAIVE ENTRANCE FEES FOR NATIONAL PUBLIC LANDS DAY  Superintendent Walter J. Chavez announces the commemoration of the annual National Public Lands Day on Saturday, September 25.   September 16, 2010  CARIBBEAN PIRATES IN CASTILLO SAN CRISTOBAL  Early morning on September 8, a Walt Disney filming crew began transforming Castillo San Cristobal’s historic ramp entrance to set the stage for a scene of “Pirates of the Caribbean: On Stranger Tides,” starring Johnny Depp and Penélope Cruz   June 15, 2010  BEACH CLEAN-UP  San Juan National Historic Site announces their annual spring clean up activity on the beach of Castillo San Cristobal.  Volunteers are invited to participate in the beach clean-up which is scheduled for Saturday, May 15 2010 from 9:00 a.m. to 12:00 p.m... This stretch of beach sits on the north side of Castillo San Cristobal and features the historic Garita del Diablo and the community of La Perla.  Cleaning this beach contributes to caring for our environment as well as safeguarding our historical resources.   May 05, 2010  SAN JUAN NATIONAL HISTORIC SITE:PASEO DEL MORRO TRAIL CLEAN-UP  Superintendent Walter J Chavez announced the annual San Juan National Historic Site spring clean up activity to be held on Saturday, May 15 from 9:00 a.m. to 12:00 p.m.   May 05, 2010  SAN JUAN NATIONAL HISTORIC SITE PASEO DEL MORRO CLEAN-UP  Superintendent Walter J Chavez announced the annual spring park clean up activity to be held on Saturday, May 15 from 9:00 a.m. to 12:00 p.m.   April 27, 2010  SAN JUAN NATIONAL HISTORIC SITE BEACH CLEAN-UP  Superintendent Walter J Chavez announced the annual spring park clean up activity to be held on Saturday, May 15 from 9:00 a.m. to 12:00 p.m.    April 08, 2010  COMMEMORATION OF THE 1797 BRITISH ATTACK ON SAN JUAN  San Juan National Historic Site will host a series of activities from April 23 - 25, 2010 to commemorate the 1797 British Attack on San Juan.   March 29, 2010  SAN JUAN NATIONAL HISTORIC SITE WOMENS HISTORY CELEBRATION  SAN JUAN NATIONAL HISTORIC SITE CELEBRATES WOMEN’S HISTORY MONTH   February 25, 2010  SIXTH ANNUAL KITE FESTIVAL  No abstract supplied.   February 11, 2010  COME CELEBRATE SAN JUAN NATIONAL HISTORIC SITE's 61st ANNIVERSARY  61 st Anniversary celebration of the SJNHS becoming a National Park Service unit   January 11, 2010  UNEXPECTED DISCOVERY OF HISTORIC RELICS BURIED IN CASTILLO SAN FELIPE DEL MORRO  No abstract supplied.   December 23, 2009  INVITATION AND NOTIFICATION TO THE PUBLIC  Upcoming San Juan NHS musical show & park closings.   December 03, 2009  FREE ENTRANCE TO THE FORTIFICATIONS THIS SUNDAY Dec 6  This Sunday, December 6, your Park, the San Juan National Historic Site (San Juan NHS), will reach 26 years of being designated as a World Heritage Site by the Organization of the United Nations for the Education, Science and Culture (UNESCO).   November 18, 2009  International Children's Day Celebration  San Juan National Historic Site, jointly with the Museo del Niño de PR, will celebrate 2009 Children’s International Day on Sunday, November 22 under the slogan, Let’s go out to Play!   November 09, 2009  FEE FREE DAY IN COMMEMORATION OF VETERANS DAY  Come celebrate Veterans Day and enjoy military history at San Juan National Historic Site.   August 25, 2009  NATIONAL PUBLIC LANDS DAY CELEBRATION  No abstract supplied.   March 11, 2009  fifth Annual Kite Festival  Walter J. Chavez, Superintendent, San Juan National Historic Site, announced the 5th annual San Juan National Historic Site Kite Festival to be held on Saturday March 6th from 10 am to 4 PM. The festival is traditionally held on the grounds of Castillo San Felipe del Morro and is open to the public free of charge. “We are very pleased to hold this event for a 6th consecutive year.  The Kite Festival provides an excellent opportunity for our visitors to participate in contests, educational talks, and of course kite flying, while educating them about the environmental issues relating to kite flying and maintaining the grounds of El Morro.   February 09, 2009  SAN JUAN NHS CELEBRATES 60 YEARS OF PRESERVATION AND PROTECTION  San Juan National Historic Site will offer several programs and activities in commemoration of the parks 60th Anniversary on Saturday, February 14th, 2009. Entrance fees to the fortifications of Castillo San Cristobal and Castillo San Felipe del Morro will be waived on this day so that visitors can enjoy the fortifications and help the park commemorate this special occasion. San Juan National Historic Site was established as a Historic Site in 1949 and a World Heritage Site in 1983.    October 14, 2008  Closure of Fortifications  The fortifications of Castillo San Cristobal and Castillo San Felipe del Morro will be closed on Wednesday, October 15, 2008.    September 22, 2008  National Public Lands Day  Walter J. Chavez, Superintendent, San Juan National Historic Site announces the observance of  National Public Lands Day (NPLD) on Saturday, September 27th from 9am to 12pm at Paseo del Morro trail starting at the San Juan Gate. NPLD is the nation's largest hands-on volunteer effort to improve and enhance America’s public lands. Last year over 100,000 volunteers built trails and bridges, planted trees and plants, and removed trash and invasive plants.  At San Juan NHS last year, approximately a 100 volunteers picked up over 4 tons of garbage from the area surrounding Fort San Juan de la Cruz (Cañuelo) in Isla De Cabras.   April 21, 2008  SAN JUAN NATIONAL HISTORIC SITE HOSTS VOLUNTEER ACTIVITY  Beach Cleanup   April 21, 2008  Celebration of National Volunteer Week at San Juan National Historic Site  No abstract supplied.   October 11, 2007  San Juan National Historic Site Inaugurates New Trams  San Juan National Historic Site Superintendent Walter J. Chavez announced today the beginning of a new tram service that will run between the two forts, Castillo San Cristóbal and Castillo San Felipe de Morro.   April 25, 2007  National Park Week 2007 Schedule of Events  Walter J. Chavez, Superintendent of San Juan National Historic Site announced today the Schedule of Events for National Park Week, April 22nd to the 28th.   April 25, 2007  INTERIOR DEPUTY SECRETARY LYNN SCARLETT HELPS LAUNCH NEW JUNIOR RANGER PROGRAM AT SAN JUAN NHS  No abstract supplied.   April 19, 2007  San Juan National Historic Site Celebrates National Park Week  Walter J. Chavez, Superintendent of San Juan National Historic Site announced today the celebration of National Park Week, April 22nd to the 28th.   March 15, 2007  National Park Service Hosts Listening Session on $3 Billion National Park Centennial Initiative  NPS Hosts Listening Session on $3 Billion National Park Centennial Initiative   March 01, 2007  Annual Kite Festival  No abstract supplied.   September 07, 2006  National Public Lands Day at Fort San Cristobal, September 30, 2006  National Public Lands Day at San Juan National Historic Site.   July 03, 2006  San Juan National Historic Site Welcomes New Citizens  More than 200 local residents took the Oath of Allegiance and became United States citizens during a special ceremony on July 3rd at San Juan National Historic Site.   June 08, 2005  NPS Director Visits San Juan NHS  No abstract supplied.
